jobs.description:
Amazon Leo is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

As a Sr. System Development Engineer, you will build tools and processes for monitoring, operating, and scaling ground infrastructure to millions of users around the globe. Use and enhance the tools you and the team develop. Using metrics, scalability in design, and continuous improvement, you will automate repetitive processes to eliminate outages and enable high availability of the ground infrastructure.



Key job responsibilities
- Continuously strive for operational excellence by seeking to automate away manual processes
- Ensure that all systems are designed to be robust, scalable, maintainable and adaptable as the service scales and evolves over time
- Build and maintain critical infrastructure, tools and operating procedures to report on the health of ground infrastructure.
- Integrate with other existing systems such as trouble ticketing, dashboards, and metrics tools and services
- Measure and improve the performance and availability of the Amazon Leo Ground Infrastructure
- Provide critical operations support and incident response for the service, while taking part in an on-call rotation

A day in the life
Design, Coding, Operational Excellence:

Work with business partners, engineers, design of systems. We need your ideas and your ability to take initiative, innovate, and produce results as we continuously improve the customer experience.

Day to day work will vary between automation or other scripting work, operational excellence initiatives, design meetings, coordination with engineering teams and external partners, and an on-call rotation.

About the team
The team is comprised of a leader and System Development Engineers in North America, Europe and Australia. The overall mission is to ensure Amazon Leo Ground Infrastructure is always available to serve customers.

3. Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Technical Program Managers, and cross-functional engineering teams to deliver new product features.

5. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.

jobs.description:
Amazon is seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Senior Training Manager to lead global Powered Industrial Truck (PIT) Training within the Workplace Health & Safety (WHS) organization.
This position offers the chance to modernize and scale PIT training worldwide, building mechanisms that strengthen safety outcomes and support compliance across Operations. The Sr. Mgr will own the launch of new PIT training content, oversee continuous improvement, and guide change management efforts. A key part of the role is ensuring all training programs, materials, and procedures meet global regulatory requirements and internal compliance standards, and that updates are implemented consistently across regions.
You will work cross-functionally with WHS, Operations, Learning, Instructional Designers, and global business partners to design, deploy, audit, and refine PIT training. This includes monitoring regulatory changes, validating alignment with compliance expectations, and partnering with legal and policy teams as needed.
Success in this role requires strong analytical acumen, clear communication, and the ability to influence leaders at every level. You will build strategy, drive execution, develop KPIs, and continually identify opportunities to improve adoption, effectiveness, compliance, and overall operational excellence.


Key job responsibilities
• Lead the global strategy, development, launch, and maintenance of PIT training programs, maintaining alignment with regulatory requirements and internal compliance standards.
• Serve as the global subject-matter expert (SME) for PIT training, acting as the primary point of contact for compliance expectations across regions and business units.
• Design and execute global training roadmaps, including gap analyses, standard setting, and long-term regulatory readiness planning.
• Lead change management efforts for new and updated PIT training, driving consistent implementation, adoption, and regulatory alignment worldwide.
• Establish scalable communication mechanisms to support training launches, program updates, and compliance or regulatory changes.
• Audit PIT training procedures, documentation, and materials, partnering with national and global teams to achieve accuracy, consistency, and regulatory adherence.
• Build and maintain strong cross-functional partnerships with WHS, Operations, Learning, Legal, and global stakeholders to embed training into operational rhythms and strengthen safety culture.
• Define and manage success metrics and KPIs, using data to measure program effectiveness, learner performance, compliance health, and business impact.
• Analyze trends and risks to identify compliance gaps and improvement opportunities, driving continuous improvement through stakeholder feedback and data insights.
• Provide clear leadership reporting through business reviews and status updates, highlighting progress, risks, compliance posture, and corrective actions.

jobs.description:
Amazon Workplace Health & Safety (WHS) mission is to provide tools, resources, and environments that support safe, efficient, and healthy behaviors and encourage employees to proactively manage their health and well being. To support this focus area, Amazon is seeking a leader to serve as our Program Manager for Worldwide WHS to build programs that create a safe workplace and build a world-class safety culture. In this role, you will dive deep into operations processes; identify risks through data and first-hand experience; build programs and improve processes to eliminate risks; and influence operations to sustain a culture of safety. This role will focus on leading large, strategic projects within Amazon Business Units (BU) and across different geographies – the role will also look for ways to replicate these BU-specific solutions to other BU, and find commonalities to support scale and speed.

The Program manager role will challenge you to push boundaries and lead transformative innovation while having the autonomy to make rapid data-driven decisions and invent on behalf of Operators (leaders) and Associates. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with members from various teams, including Operations; Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT); Amazon Robotics (AR); Inbound Supply Chain; Launch; Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP); Capacity Planning; Finance and others to deploy solutions at scale.

This position requires travel up to approximately 25%, when needed (and with appropriate health and safety conditions).

Key job responsibilities

Manage complex program life-cycles that span multiple business units, delivering projects that achieve meaningful safety improvement metrics across fulfillment centers.
Define and scope safety improvement initiatives, set clear objectives, analyze data, and drive improvements quantified with specific metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders across multiple business units to identify safety risks and develop innovative solutions to engineer these risks out of our fulfillment centers.
Apply relevant tools and mechanisms to track progress, communicate status to stakeholders, and escalate issues when required to maintain project timelines.
Anticipate potential blockers by looking around corners, develop mitigation strategies, and balance simultaneous tasks to ensure consistent project delivery.

A day in the life
Your typical day involves balancing short-term site-level program delivery with long-term business-wide change initiatives. You'll start by reviewing safety metrics across fulfillment centers, identifying trends that require attention. Throughout the day, you'll coordinate with stakeholders across business units, influence them to meet their delivery commitments, and work to accomplish necessary tasks that move your safety programs forward. You'll analyze data to track progress against safety improvement metrics and adjust plans as needed to keep projects on track.

About the team
Our team is dedicated to engineering risk out of Amazon's fulfillment centers through innovative program delivery. We work across multiple business units to identify safety improvement opportunities and implement solutions that protect our employees while maintaining operational excellence. The team's mission focuses on developing and delivering programs that drive measurable safety improvements across the network. Our collaborative approach brings together expertise from various disciplines to create comprehensive safety solutions that address both immediate concerns and long-term strategic goals.

jobs.description:
Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN), a Fortune 500 company based in Seattle, opened on the World Wide Web in July 1995 and today offers Earth's Biggest Selection. Amazon.com, Inc. seeks to be Earth's most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online, and endeavors to offer its customers the lowest possible prices. Today, we operate retail websites in nine countries, offering millions of products in more than 40 categories worldwide, and we still like to work hard, have fun and make history!

About the Team:
RBS Brand Experience (BX) enables worldwide brands (FBA Sellers and Retail Vendors) with strategic, actionable insights and recommendations through brands-facing solutions, self-help tools, and updated policies to empower them to take a customer backwards approach that drives business growth while reducing the Cost to Serve for both Amazon and Brands. We do this by: 1) identifying and validating underserved Brand pain points, 2) building proof of concept, solution and capabilities in partnership with Brands, 3) scaling the solution by leveraging tech, 4) launching full scale brand facing solutions to WW brands, and 5) continuously improve solutions through control mechanisms (such as; monitoring impact, user base, adoption, GTM).

Job Overview:
Amazon's Brand Experience (BX) team is seeking an exceptional Senior UX Designer to transform complex brand challenges into intuitive, scalable solutions that drive seller and vendor success. In this role, you will lead user research initiatives, conduct discovery workshops, and translate insights into compelling design solutions. You will collaborate closely with product management and engineering to design wireframes, user flows, and high-quality UX solutions. You will influence the product roadmap and ensure our services are highly usable for both builders and non-technical customers, while revamping existing product experiences to create richer, more engaging interactions for users.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead comprehensive user research initiatives including user interviews, usability testing, and competitive analysis to inform design decisions and validate solutions
• Plan and facilitate customer discovery sessions, workshops, and feedback loops to deeply understand user needs, pain points, and behaviors
• Synthesize research findings into actionable insights that drive product strategy and design direction
• Lead the end-to-end delivery of simplified solutions for the best outcome, present a variety of those solutions, and represent the benefits and challenges with each approach
• Handle complex problems/efforts, decisions, and escalations as well as determine where to simplify or extend solutions for the best outcome
• Mitigate long-term risks, balance short- vs. long-term needs, and operate effectively at both strategic and tactical levels
• Lead org reviews and critiques, and craft/present key narratives (e.g., 6-pagers, business reviews, PR/FAQs, OP1/OP2 inputs) to leadership and cross-functional teams to drive focus and outcomes
• Influence product and engineering decisions by bringing the customer perspective, guiding design choices, and driving long-term impact
• Set the standard for design excellence while driving clarity in ambiguous initiatives where problems, strategies, requirements, or technical feasibility are undefined
• Advise partner teams and senior leaders on org goals and design strategy, influencing engineering decisions to enable UX solutions and driving outcomes across teams and geographies

Basic qualifications
• 5 to 7 years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar role
• An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating great user-centered design solutions is a requirement for application
• Communication and collaboration skills with proven experience partnering with developers to implement designs.
• Demonstrated ability to thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments by multitasking, driving design reviews to closure, and collaborating effectively across organizational boundaries.
• Fluency in best practices for web-based information architecture and design, as well as knowledge of usability principles and techniques
• Proficient in web design considerations, with a background in design/HCI (or equivalent experience) and expertise in tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, and Visio.
• Skilled in creating interactive prototypes with design aesthetics and a focus on simplicity over complexity.
